name: Bench Press
description: A compound exercise that targets the chest, shoulders, and triceps. Lie on a bench and press the barbell from chest level to full arm extension.
instructions: Lie flat on a bench with your feet firmly planted on the ground
Grip the barbell with hands slightly wider than shoulder-width
Lower the bar to your chest with control
Press the bar up explosively until your arms are fully extended
Keep your core tight and maintain proper form throughout
tips: Keep your shoulder blades retracted
Don't bounce the bar off your chest
Maintain a slight arch in your lower back
Breathe out on the way up

name: Squat
description: The king of all exercises. A compound movement that targets the entire lower body and core.
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart
Place the barbell on your upper back
Lower your body by bending at the hips and knees
Descend until your thighs are parallel to the floor
Drive through your heels to return to standing
tips: Keep your chest up and core tight
Don't let your knees cave inward
Go as low as your mobility allows
Keep your weight on your heels

name: Deadlift
description: A powerful compound exercise that works the entire posterior chain and builds functional strength.
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart, bar over mid-foot
Bend at the hips and knees to grip the bar
Keep your back straight and chest up
Drive through your heels and extend your hips
Stand up tall, pulling the bar along your legs
tips: Keep the bar close to your body
Don't round your back
Engage your lats before lifting
Finish by squeezing your glutes

name: Overhead Press
description: A compound exercise that builds shoulder strength and stability while engaging the core.
instructions: Start with the bar at shoulder level
Grip the bar with hands slightly wider than shoulders
Press the bar straight up overhead
Lower the bar back to shoulder level with control
Keep your core tight throughout the movement
tips: Don't arch your back excessively
Keep your core engaged
Press straight up, not forward
Breathe out as you press up

name: Pull-ups
description: A bodyweight exercise that builds upper body pulling strength and back development.
instructions: Hang from a pull-up bar with an overhand grip
Engage your lats and pull your shoulder blades down
Pull your body up until your chin clears the bar
Lower yourself down with control
Repeat for desired reps
tips: Start with assisted pull-ups if needed
Don't swing or use momentum
Focus on pulling with your back, not just arms
Full range of motion is key

name: Dips
description: A bodyweight exercise that targets the chest, triceps, and shoulders.
instructions: Support yourself on dip bars with arms fully extended
Lower your body by bending at the elbows
Descend until your shoulders are below your elbows
Press back up to the starting position
Keep your body upright throughout
tips: Lean forward slightly to target chest more
Don't go too low if it causes shoulder pain
Keep your core tight
Control the movement both ways
